definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident

sentences.english: The fledgling man always offends his boss.
sentences.chinese: 这个没经验的人总是顶撞他的老板。

sentences.english: Young children should never contradict what their parents say.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们绝对不应顶撞父母。

sentences.english: No child should be woulslowed to answer back.
sentences.chinese: 不应该答应任何孩子顶撞。

sentences.english: I'm not sassing you in Eskimo talk.
sentences.chinese: 我没有用爱斯基摩口吻顶撞你。

sentences.english: Large firms do not wish to antagonize the federal government unduly .
sentences.chinese: 大厂商并不想过分地与政府发生顶撞。

sentences.english: This was a child, speaking against them, a child tal king like a grown man.
sentences.chinese: 因为这是一个孩子在顶撞他们，而且说话像大人一样。

sentences.english: Consider him who endured from sinners such hostility against himself, so that you may not grow weary or fainthearted .
sentences.chinese: 那忍受罪人这样顶撞的，你们要思想，免得疲倦灰心。

sentences.english: How dare you conflict with your boss?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么敢顶撞你的老板？

sentences.english: Mu Panba not figure it out, but dare to contradict the teacher .
sentences.chinese: 姆潘巴想不通，但又敢顶撞老师。

sentences.english: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds.
sentences.chinese: 那忍受罪人这样顶撞的，你们要思想，免得疲倦灰心。

sentences.english: He faced me out that he know nothing about the matter.
sentences.chinese: 他固执地顶撞我说，他对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: He contradicted the manager at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他在会议上顶撞了经理。

sentences.english: It is shocking that such a young child would dare to contradict his parents.
sentences.chinese: 小的孩子就敢顶撞家长，真不成话。

sentences.english: The result is not good, occasionally contradicts to the class leader.
sentences.chinese: 成绩不好，偶尔也顶撞班长。

definition: to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
